newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah steady despite campaign violence.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah steady despite campaign violence.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was steady against the dollar in late trading on Friday, dealers said.

They said volume was thin in sluggish trading as most local operators left early fearing violence on the final day of election campaign. Witnesses later reported a clash between rival political groups in a southern suburb of the capital.
"There is no reaction because people have gone home already. There is hardly any counter party in the market," one of the only few remaining local bank dealers said.
One foreign bank dealer said operators had squared their positions early on Friday in anticipation of violence.
Dealers said despite earlier false rumours of clashes, local operators were not pressured. They said the rupiah even strengthened briefly at midday.
Spot rupiah was last 2,442.25/42.75 at 0945 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,440.0/42.0. Today closed at 2,440.75/41.5.
Dealers said liquidity was sufficient, with overnight money trading last at 10.0 percent.

Witnesses said police fired tear gas, rubber bullets and shots into the air to break up a fight between supporters of the United Development Party (PPP) and rivals from the ruling Golkar party in the Ciputat area of southern Jakarta.
Jakarta was tense through the day, with many schools closed and a number of offices shutting down early on fears of trouble after violence between PPP and Golkar partisans earlier in the week.
Dealers said longer-term swap rates were edging up on foreign buying on fears that Jakarta operators might follow Thai steps to stop quoting tom/next swaps to foreigners.
One state bank dealer said fears of a squeeze in tom/next swaps drove swap rates up but cooled off later.
"They don't want to be left over with no rupiah. They just tried to accumulate some rupiah. But they seemed to reverse their perceptions later in the afternoon," the dealer said.
Overnight swap was at 1.2/1.4 and spot/next at 0.6/0.8.
One-month swaps were at 17.0/19.0, two at 32.0/34.0, three at 44.0/48.0 and six at 86.0/89.0 points.
The central bank raised its intervention band by one point to 2,412/2,604 but lowered its conversion band by one point to 2,419/2,467 on Friday. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
